sen.j: 大山崎町（おおやまざきちょう）は、京都府乙訓郡の町。
sen.e: Oyamazaki-cho is a town in Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oyamazaki-cho is a town in Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oyamazaki-cho is a town in Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 大阪府三島郡 (大阪府)島本町との府境に位置する。
sen.e: It is located on the border with Shimamoto-cho, Mishima-gun, Osaka Prefecture.
It is located on the border with Shimamoto-cho, Mishima-gun, Osaka Prefecture.
It is located on the border with Shimamoto-cho, Mishima-gun, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 京都府下で最も面積の小さい町である。
sen.e: It is the smallest town in area in Kyoto Prefecture.
It is the smallest town in area in Kyoto Prefecture.
It is the smallest town in area in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 旧山城国乙訓郡。
sen.e: The town belonged to former Otokuni-no-kori (present-day Otokuni-gun), Yamashiro Province.
The town belonged to former Otokuni-no-kori (present-day Otokuni-gun), Yamashiro Province.
The town belonged to former Otokuni-no-kori (present-day Otokuni-gun), Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 丘陵地が平野に近く迫り、そのふもとに桂川 (淀川水系)と宇治川、木津川 (京都府)の合流点が位置するため、山崎は古来から交通の要地であった。
sen.e: Yamazaki has been a focal point for transportation since ancient times because the junctions of the Kizu-gawa and Uji-gawa Rivers as well as the Uji-gawa (Yodo-gawa River System) and Katsura-gawa Rivers are located at the foot of the hillside stretching deep into the plain.

Yamazaki has been a focal point for transportation since ancient times because the junctions of the Kizu-gawa and Uji-gawa Rivers as well as the Uji-gawa (Yodo-gawa River System) and Katsura-gawa Rivers are located at the foot of the hillside stretching deep into the plain.

Yamazaki has been a focal point for transportation since ancient times because the confluence of the Katsura-gawa (Yodo-gawa River system), Uji-gawa as well as Kizu-gawa Rivers are located at the foot of the hillside stretching deep into the plain.
sen.cmt: 一部修正しました。"Katsura-gawa"→"the Katsura-gawa"に変更しました。

sen.j: 明智光秀を豊臣秀吉（当時は羽柴秀吉）が破った山崎の戦いは大山崎町天王山で行われた。
sen.e: The Battle of Yamazaki, in which Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI (called Mitsuhide AKECHI at that time) defeated Mitsuhide AKECHI, was waged in Tenno-zan Mountain in Oyamazaki-cho.
The Battle of Yamazaki, in which Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI (called Mitsuhide AKECHI at that time) defeated Mitsuhide AKECHI, was waged in Tenno-zan Mountain in Oyamazaki-cho.
The Battle of Yamazaki, in which Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI (called Hideyoshi HASHIBA at that time) defeated Mitsuhide AKECHI, was waged in Mt. Tenno in Oyamazaki-cho.

sen.j: この故事から雌雄を決することを「天王山を迎える」という成句が生まれた。
sen.e: The idiomatic phrase 'Tenno-zan wo mukaeru' (approach Tenno-zan), meaning 'to have a showdown,' originated from this historical event.
The idiomatic phrase 'Tenno-zan wo mukaeru' (approach Tenno-zan), meaning 'to have a showdown,' originated from this historical event.
The idiomatic phrase 'Tenno-zan wo mukaeru' (approach Tenno-zan), meaning 'to have a showdown,' originated from this historical event.

sen.j: 大阪府の島本町山崎から京都府の大山崎町にかけての山崎の地はまた名水で知られる。
sen.e: Water in the Yamazaki area from Yamazaki Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture to Oyamazaki-cho, Kyoto Prefecture is known for its quality.
Water in the Yamazaki area from Yamazaki Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture to Oyamazaki-cho, Kyoto Prefecture is known for its quality.
Water in the Yamazaki area from Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture to Oyamazaki-cho, Kyoto Prefecture is known for its quality.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: また山崎駅 (京都府)前の妙喜庵には千利休の現存する二例の茶室作例の一つである茶室待庵（国宝）が現存する。
sen.e: The Myokian Temple in front of Yamazaki Station holds the tea ceremony house called 'Taian' (a National Treasure), one of the two existing tea ceremony houses designed by SEN no Rikyu.
The Myokian Temple in front of Yamazaki Station holds the tea ceremony house called 'Taian' (a National Treasure), one of the two existing tea ceremony houses designed by SEN no Rikyu.

The Myokian Temple in front of Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) holds the tea ceremony house called 'Taian' (a national treasure), one of the two existing tea ceremony houses designed by SEN no Rikyu.
sen.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: タケノコの産地として著名。
sen.e: Oyamazaki-cho is famous for producing bamboo shoots.
Oyamazaki-cho is famous for producing bamboo shoots.
Oyamazaki-cho is famous for producing bamboo shoots.

sen.j: 京野菜の京山科ナス、ミズナの産地でもある。
sen.e: Traditional Kyoto vegetables such as Kyo-yamashina eggplant and potherb mustard are also grown.
Traditional Kyoto vegetables such as Kyo-yamashina eggplant and potherb mustard are also grown.
Traditional Kyoto vegetables such as Kyo-yamashina eggplant and potherb mustard are also grown.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 725年（神亀2年） 行基、山崎に橋を架けて布教の拠点とする。
sen.e: In 725, Gyoki built a bridge to Yamazaki and propagated Buddhism, based in the area.
In 725, Gyoki built a bridge to Yamazaki and propagated Buddhism, based in the area.
725: Gyoki built a bridge to Yamazaki and propagated Buddhism, based in the area.

sen.j: 784年（延暦3年） 長岡京の建設に伴い、山崎に橋を架けられる。
sen.e: In 784, a bridge to Yamazaki was spanned when Nagaoka-kyo (imperial capital) was built.
In 784, a bridge was built to span Yamazaki when Nagaoka-kyo (imperial capital) was established.
725: A bridge was built to span Yamazaki when Nagaoka-kyo (imperial capital) was established.

sen.j: 811年（弘仁2年） 嵯峨天皇が山崎河陽離宮に行幸する。
sen.e: In 811, Emperor Saga paid a visit to the Kaya-rikyu (Kaya Imperial Villa) in Yamazaki.
In 811, Emperor Saga paid a visit to the Kaya-rikyu (Kaya Imperial Villa) in Yamazaki.
811: Emperor Saga paid a visit to the Kaya-rikyu (Kaya Imperial Villa) in Yamazaki.

sen.j: 861年（貞観 (日本)3年） 山崎河陽離宮が山城国府と定められる。
sen.e: In 861, the Kaya-rikyu in Yamazaki was designated as the kokufu (a provincial office in ancient times).
In 861, the Kaya-rikyu in Yamazaki was designated as the kokufu (a provincial office in ancient times).
861: The Kaya-rikyu in Yamazaki was designated as the kokufu (a provincial office in ancient times).

sen.j: 1200年（正治2年） 藤原定家が水無瀬離宮への道中の途中で山崎の油売り小屋に泊まる。
sen.e: In 1200, FUJIWARA no Sadaie stayed at the oil seller's hut in Yamazaki on the way to the Minase-rikyu (Minase Imperial Villa).
In 1200, FUJIWARA no Sadaie stayed at the oil seller's hut in Yamazaki on the way to the Minase-rikyu (Minase Imperial Villa).
1200: FUJIWARA no Sadaie stayed at the oil seller's hut in Yamazaki on the way to the Minase-rikyu (Minase Imperial Villa).

sen.j: 1276年（建治2年） この頃、京都の油販売を山崎神人が独占。
sen.e: Around 1276, the sale of oil was dominated by the jinin (shrine dependents) in Yamazaki.
Around 1276, the sale of oil was dominated by the jinin (shrine dependents) in Yamazaki.
1276: The sale of oil was dominated by the jinin (shrine dependents) in Yamazaki.

sen.j: 1311年（応長元年） 伏見上皇、山崎神人のために淀などの関津料を免除する。
sen.e: In 1311, the retired Emperor Fushimi waived the seki-tsu-ryo (tax at checkpoints, 関津料) in Yodo for the jinin in Yamazaki.
In 1311, the retired Emperor Fushimi waived the seki-tsu-ryo (tax at checkpoints, 関津料) in Yodo for the jinin in Yamazaki.
1311: The Retired Emperor Fushimi waived the seki-tsu-ryo (tax at checkpoints, 関津料) in Yodo for the jinin in Yamazaki.
sen.cmt: Retired としました。"In 1311, the"→"1311: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1333年（元弘2年／正慶3年） 播磨国の赤松円心が山崎に陣する。
sen.e: In 1333, Enshin AKAMATSU in Harima Province set up a camp in Yamazaki.
In 1333, Enshin AKAMATSU in Harima Province set up a camp in Yamazaki.
1333: Enshin AKAMATSU in Harima Province set up a camp in Yamazaki.

sen.j: 1392年（元中9年／明徳3年） 足利義満、大山崎に守護不入の権限を与える。
sen.e: In 1392, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA gave Oyamazaki the right to prohibit the Shugo (provincial constable) from entering the territory.
In 1392, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA gave Oyamazaki the right to prohibit the Shugo (provincial constable) from entering the territory.
1392: Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA gave Oyamazaki the right to prohibit the Shugo (provincial constable) from entering the territory.

sen.j: 1422年（応永29年） 美濃国国司が大山崎商人に不破関の無料通行を許す。
sen.e: In 1422, the Kokushi (provincial governor) in Mino Province allowed the merchants from Yamazaki to pass through the Fuwa-no-seki (Fuwa checkpoint) for free.
In 1422, the Kokushi (provincial governor) in Mino Province allowed the merchants from Yamazaki to pass through the Fuwa-no-seki (Fuwa checkpoint) for free.
1422: The Kokushi (provincial governor) in Mino Province allowed the merchants from Oyamazaki to pass through the Fuwa-no-seki (Fuwa checkpoint) for free.
sen.cmt: 大山崎 としました。"In 1422, the"→"1422: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1568年（永禄11年） 大山崎惣中、織田信長に矢銭を献ずる。
sen.e: In 1568, self-governing village communities in Oyamazaki provided Nobunaga ODA funding for the war.
In 1568, self-governing village communities in Oyamazaki provided Nobunaga ODA funding for the war.
1568: Self-governing village communities in Oyamazaki provided Nobunaga ODA funding for the war.

sen.j: 1582年（天正10年） 羽柴秀吉と明智光秀が山崎に戦う。
sen.e: In 1582, Hideyoshi HASHIBA fought against Mitsuhide AKECHI in Yamazaki.
In 1582, Hideyoshi HASHIBA fought against Mitsuhide AKECHI in Yamazaki.
1582: Hideyoshi HASHIBA fought against Mitsuhide AKECHI in Yamazaki.

sen.j: この後、秀吉は山崎を拠点とする。
sen.e: Hideyoshi set up a base in Yamazaki thereafter.
Hideyoshi set up a base in Yamazaki thereafter.
Hideyoshi set up a base in Yamazaki thereafter.

sen.j: 江戸時代は八幡宮の神領として自治を許される。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Yamazaki was granted autonomy as the domain of the Hachimangu Shrine.
In the Edo period, Yamazaki was granted autonomy as the domain of the Hachimangu Shrine.
In the Edo period, Yamazaki was granted autonomy as the domain of the Hachimangu Shrine.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年） 大山崎村・円明寺村・下植野村の3村が合併し、大山崎村が誕生。
sen.e: In 1889, the three villages of Oyamazaki-mura, Enmyoji-mura and Shimoueno-mura were merged to form Oyamazaki-mura.
In 1889, the three villages of Oyamazaki-mura, Enmyoji-mura and Shimoueno-mura were merged to form Oyamazaki-mura.
1889: The three villages of Oyamazaki-mura, Enmyoji-mura and Shimoueno-mura were merged to form Oyamazaki-mura.

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年） 大山崎町となる。
sen.e: In 1967, Oyamazaki-mura became Oyamazaki-cho.
In 1967, Oyamazaki-mura became Oyamazaki-cho.
1967: Oyamazaki-mura became Oyamazaki-cho.

sen.j: かつては米作などの農業、およびタケノコなどの採取が有名であった。
sen.e: Oyamazaki-cho was known for agriculture such as rice farming as well as gathering of bamboo shoots.
Oyamazaki-cho was known for agriculture such as rice farming as well as gathering of bamboo shoots.
Oyamazaki-cho was known for agriculture such as rice farming as well as gathering of bamboo shoots.

sen.j: 高度成長期以降、国道171号線沿いに工場や倉庫が増加した。
sen.e: The number of factories and warehouses along the National Highway 171 has increased since the beginning of the high-growth period.
The number of factories and warehouses along the National Highway 171 has increased since the beginning of the high-growth period.
The number of factories and warehouses along the National Route 171 has increased since the beginning of the high-growth period.

sen.j: 特にダイハツ工業、日立製作所、日立マクセルなどの大工場がある。
sen.e: Among them are the large factories of Daihatsu Motor Co., Ltd., Hitachi, Ltd. and Hitachi Maxell, Ltd.
Among them are the large factories of Daihatsu Motor Co., Ltd., Hitachi, Ltd. and Hitachi Maxell, Ltd.
Among them are the large factories of Daihatsu Motor Co., Ltd., Hitachi, Ltd. and Hitachi Maxell, Ltd.

sen.j: ゲームソフト開発のトーセも登記上本店及び開発センターを置く。
sen.e: Tose Co., Ltd., the developer of video games, has set up the headquarters and development center in the land registry.
Tose Co., Ltd., a developer of video games, set up their headquarters and development center in the land registry.
Tose Co., Ltd., a developer of video games, set up their headquarters and development center in the land registry.

sen.j: なお、サントリー山崎蒸溜所は大阪府島本町に所在し、本町には所在しない。
sen.e: Suntory Yamazaki Distillery, however, is located in Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture, not in Oyamazaki-cho.
Suntory Yamazaki Distillery, however, is located in Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture, not in Oyamazaki-cho.
Suntory Yamazaki Distillery, however, is located in Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture, not in Oyamazaki-cho.

sen.j: 一方、同社京都ビール工場の一部が町域に所在する。
sen.e: Suntory Kyoto Brewery, on the other hand, is partly located in the town.
